name: Handstand Pushup
how_to_perform:
1. Start by finding a wall or other prop to support your body in a handstand position, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body forming an inverted 'V' shape.

2. Engage your core and lift your lower back off the ground, squeezing your glutes and pushing your heels towards the ceiling.

3. Slowly lower your upper body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body and your shoulders engaged.

4. Lower until your chest nearly touches the ground, then press back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on control and proper form throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Handstand pushups target the muscles of the upper body, including the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
